anime.description: The Iwatobi Swimming Club is back and struggles with the recruitment of new members. At the same time, senior members Haru and Makoto have to figure out what to do after high school, challenging their love for swimming. Meanwhile an old childhood friend of Rin returns and stirs up some trouble - especially with Haru. How is the Iwatobi gang going to respond?!

tag.name: maintenance tags
tag.description: These tags are used for maintenance.

tag.name: transfer student
tag.description: A transfer student is a student who changes from one institution or course to another at the same level. Their arrival, when not at the beginning of the school year, tends to cause a stir.

tag.name: swimming
tag.description: Swimming is an individual or team sport that involves using arms and legs to move the body through water. Typically, the sport takes place in pools or in open water. Competitive swimming is one of the most popular Olympic sports, with events in butterfly, backstroke, breaststroke, freestyle, and individual medley. In addition to these individual events, swimmers take part in relays. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: bishounen
tag.description: Young man whose beauty (and sexual appeal) transcends the boundary of gender or sexual orientation.

tag.name: high school
tag.description: A secondary school that usually contains grades 10 through 12 in Japan, or 9 through 12 in America.

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: fetishes
tag.description: Everything under fetishes (except for Bishounen and Juujin) is strictly only meant for hentai (18 Restricted) and ecchi anime. In case of ecchi, it must be the main element of the show and not when there`s only some of it, for example, there`s some ecchi in Shinseiki Evangelion, but the fact you get to see Asuka`s pantsu doesn`t warrant it the schoolgirl fetish category. So be careful to which ecchi show you add fetishes; it`s fairly straightforward with hentai, though. Overall, this category tree is to satisfy the needs of people with different fetishes, so they can search for what tingles their tangle; hence why this is restricted to hentai and full ecchi shows.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: time
tag.description: This placeholder lists different epochs in human history and more vague but important timelines such as the future, the present and the past.

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: present
tag.description: Somewhere between past and future.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: school clubs
tag.description: Even though school clubs in Japan are not mandatory, there is some pressure from the social grid (e.g. fellow students, teachers) to participate in some kind of after-school activity, be it in sports or arts. Colleges also have clubs. As a comedy element in anime, some students have joined too many clubs, and are thus constantly stressed out. There is also the element of social commentary, making it clear that you have to join a club, if you want to be part of the class. Since self-founded clubs need at least 3 members, the desperate search and advertising for new members can be cause for hilarity in anime.

tag.name: Japan
tag.description: Japan is a sovereign island nation in East Asia. Located in the Pacific Ocean, it lies off the eastern coast of the Asian mainland and stretches from the Sea of Okhotsk in the north to the East China Sea and China in the southwest. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: shounen ai
tag.description: Shounen Ai means boys love, and thus explores what happens when two boys (or men) fall in love. This is not to be mistaken for http://anidb.net/t2723 [Yaoi] which is (or, at least, how this term is often used by the western audience) used in adult works. This is not; that means there is no graphical sex. The female version is http://anidb.net/t2782 [Shoujo Ai].

tag.name: plot continuity
tag.description: Consistency of the characteristics of persons, plot, objects, places and events seen by the viewer. A single linear focused plot is highly continuous. A truly random plot is highly discontinuous.

tag.name: new
tag.description: Not based on anything, the story is a new work, usually made up by the people involved in creating the anime. Generally if an original work (原作) credit is given, it will be to the studio, or director, or other members of the production team.

tag.name: Asia
tag.description: Asia is Earth`s largest and most populous continent, located primarily in the eastern and northern hemispheres and sharing the continental landmass of Eurasia with the continent of Europe. Asia covers an area of 44,579,000 square kilometers, about 30% of Earth`s total land area and 8.7% of the Earth`s total surface area. The continent, which has long been home to the majority of the human population, was the site of many of the first civilizations. Asia is notable for not only its overall large size and population, but also dense and large settlements as well as vast barely populated regions within the continent of 4.4 billion people. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: Australia
tag.description: Australia, officially the Commonwealth of Australia, is a sovereign country comprising the mainland of the Australian continent, the island of Tasmania and numerous smaller islands. It is the largest country in Oceania and the world`s sixth-largest country by total area. The neighbouring countries are Papua New Guinea, Indonesia and East Timor to the north; the Solomon Islands and Vanuatu to the north-east; and New Zealand to the south-east. Australia`s capital is Canberra, and its largest city is Sydney. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: romance
tag.description: Romance describes a story that deals with love between two or more characters typically also having an optimistic ending. Romance is also a difficulty encountered when creating a harem.

tag.name: friendship
tag.description: The feeling of trust, kindness, and friendship between a group of high school students for example, is a central theme of this anime.

tag.name: school life
tag.description: Since a large part of the anime audience still takes part in school life or is visiting college, it is only natural to choose a setting the audience can identify with, be it elementary, middle, or high school. For the older viewers a college setting with more mature real-life problems is appropriate. And since clubs take up so much time in the lives of students, these are obviously also important.

tag.name: sports
tag.description: Sports anime revolves around a recreational physical activity or skill. In addition they often adhere to certain genre conventions, the emphasis on training and practice in preparation for competition, characters desire for self improvement, and pursuit of a specific goal.

tag.name: unsorted
tag.description: a bunch of tags that still need to be either deleted or moved into proper places.

tag.name: teamwork
tag.description: A cooperative effort by the members of a group or team to achieve a common goal.

tag.name: training
tag.description: Training is extensive, serious practising a person undergoes in order to develop skills and abilities, such as handling weapons, playing instruments, playing sports, and so on.

tag.name: colour coded
tag.description: Every single character on the main cast has a unique hair colour to help less perceptive viewers distiguish between them.

tag.name: predominantly male cast
tag.description: The anime features a mostly male cast, i.e. female characters are rare. Example: Reverse harem setting with a plethora of bishounen.

tag.name: rivalry
tag.description: Quite broadly used term describing a conflict, contest, struggle, or opposition of some sort. Typical examples: The mostly comedic rivalry for the love of a protagonist in a harem anime (love polygon), the more "mindless" battles between wannabe delinquents in a school fighting anime, or the struggle between good & evil in an epic conflict for world domination.

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO CHARACTER
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to character tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what characters they should be assigned to.

tag.name: Oceania
tag.description: Oceania is a geographic region comprising Melanesia, Micronesia, Polynesia and Australasia. Situated in the southeast of the Asia Pacific region, Oceania is the smallest continental grouping in land area and the second smallest in population after Antarctica. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Mikoshiba Seijuurou
character.description: Mikoshiba Seijuurou is attending Samezuka Academy, 3rd year. He is a captain of swimming club.

character.name: Nanase Haruka (Shougakusei)
character.description: Haruka in Elementary school.

character.name: Hazuki Nagisa (Shougakusei)
character.description: Nagisa in Elementary school.

character.name: Tachibana Makoto (Shougakusei)
character.description: Makoto in Elementary school.

character.name: Matsuoka Rin (Shougakusei)
character.description: Rin in Elementary school.

character.name: Nitori Aiichirou
character.description: Nitori Aiichirou is attending Samezuka Academy, 1st year. He is a member of swimming club.

character.name: Sasabe Gorou
character.description: Sasabe Gorou is a former coach of swimming club.

character.name: Tachibana Ren
character.description: Tachibana Ren is Makoto`s younger brother.

character.name: Tachibana Ran
character.description: Tachibana Ran is Makoto`s younger sister.

character.name: Mikoshiba Momotarou
character.description: Mikoshiba Momotarou is the younger brother of former captain Mikoshiba.

character.name: Samezuka Gakuen Suiei-bu Komon
character.description: Sugimoto is the adviser of Swimming Cluc of Samezuka Academy.

character.name: Nakagawa Shouta
character.description: Nakagawa Shouta is one of new members in the Swimming Club of Samezuka Academy.

character.name: Sera Tadanori
character.description: Rei`s senpai from track and field club.

character.name: Uozumi Takuya
character.description: Uozumi is a member of swimming club of Samezuka Academy.

character.name: Minami Ikki
character.description: Minami is a member of swimming club of Samezuka Academy.

character.name: Iwashimizu Tooru
character.description: Iwashimizu Tooru is a member of swimming club of Samezuka Academy.

character.name: Shigino Kisumi
character.description: Kisumi is Haru and Makoto`s schoolmate from junior high school and Hayato`s older brother.

character.name: Shigino Hayato
character.description: Hayato is a kid from Iwatobi swimming club who was scared of water.

character.name: Kouchou-sensei
character.description: Principal of Iwatobi High School.

character.name: Seikatsu Shidou Kyouyu
character.description: Guidance counselor of Iwatobi High School.

character.name: Shigino Kisumi (Shougakusei)
character.description: Kisumi at elementary school age.

episode.title: 約束のサマーソルトターン!
Somersault Turn of Promise!
Le virage promis !
Yakusoku no Somersault Turn!
episode.summary: In anticipation of the upcoming prefectural tournament, the members of the Samezuka Swim Club enthusiastically show off their individual abilities. At the Iwatobi Swim Club, an equally enthusiastic Gou proposes a lunchbox inspection to ensure the boys are getting the right nutrition to support their training. However... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 別れのバタフライ!
Butterfly of Farewell!
Le papillon des adieux !
Wakare no Butterfly!
episode.summary: The Iwatobi Festival has begun! Haruka and friends are fired up for the Club-versus-Club Relay Race, hoping to attract new members by putting in an impressive performance. Meanwhile, Rei begins training but is worried by the fact that he can still only swim the butterfly stroke… Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 邂逅のストローク!
Stroke of Chance Encounter!
La nage du destin !
Kaikou no Stroke!
episode.summary: The crew ponders how to attract new members to the Swim Club. Haruka is called in by Amakata-sensei to discuss his intended career path, but as always, Haruka moves to the beat of his own drum. Meanwhile, Coach Sasabe brings an interesting opportunity to the boys… Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 嵐のダイブダッシュ!
Storm of Dive and Dash!
Une course endiablée !
Arashi no Dive Dash!
episode.summary: Haruka and his friends have grown after last summer’s tournament. Amidst the hustle and bustle of training for their individual events, their daily lives continue as usual. However, a new season now approaches! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 変局のロコモーティブ!
Locomotive of Crisis!
La curieuse locomotive !
Henkyoku no Locomotive!
episode.summary: While Haruka and the boys redouble their training in the wake of prefecturals, Makoto notices Gou looking troubled and asks her what’s wrong. She tells him that Coach Sasabe has been so busy with his Swim Club lately, he hasn’t been by to approve their new training regimen. Makoto offers to go see him for her, but what he finds at the Swim Club is... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 雪辱のクラウチングスタート!
Crouching Start of Revenge!
Le Track Start de la revanche !
Setsujoku no Crouching Start!
episode.summary: Haruka and the boys have trained hard to prepare for this showdown against Samezuka. After Day 1 of the tournament, Gou and Amakata-sensei treat the boys to a fabulous, carb-rich feast and allow them to take a breather. Meanwhile, Rin is faced with a tough decision as captain of the Samezuka Swim Club. Who will he choose to swim the relay with him? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 無敵のプライム!
Prime of Invincibility!
L’invincible premier !
Muteki no Prime!
episode.summary: On the eve of prefecturals, Makoto resolves himself to broach a certain subject with Haruka. As the tournament begins, the Iwatobi Swim Club is extremely enthusiastic about its prospects. But will every member be able to pass the prelims of his individual events? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 決意のヘッドアップ!
Head-Up of Decision!
Respiration déterminée !
Ketsui no Head Up!
episode.summary: The members of the Iwatobi Swim Club ponder over the cause of Nagisa’s odd behavior at the end of practice that day. Though they time their chance well to ask Nagisa what’s happened, Nagisa stubbornly refuses to explain why he’s upset... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 異郷のスイムオフ!
Swim-Off in a Foreign Land!
Prolongations à l`étranger !
Ikyou no Swim-Off!
episode.summary: Upon Rin’s invitation, Haruka finds himself venturing to “a certain country.” Knowing that Haruka has hit a wall worrying about his future, Rin opens up and speaks to him about his own thoughts and feelings. Afterward, Rin quietly asks Haruka what he will do about his own future... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 運命のネバーターン!
Backstroke Turn of Fate!
Le virage de la destinée !
Unmei no Never Turn!
episode.summary: The Iwatobi Swim Club continues their training. However, signs of confusion seem to keep surfacing in the silent Haruka’s swimming. Makoto and the others are worried about him, but try to continue acting cheerfully as though nothing was wrong. But one day, Sousuke appears, asking to speak to Haruka… Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 涙のシックスビート!
Six-Beat of Tears!
Les larmes des six battements !
Namida no Six Beat!
episode.summary: As the tournament continues, Sousuke finally tells Rin about how he’s passed their years of separation. Rin is concerned at Sousuke’s nonchalant attitude toward certain things and tries to speak his mind. Meanwhile, the Iwatobi Swim Club looks toward the relay final. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 失速のフォーミング!
Forming of Disruption!
Forme au ralenti !
Shissoku no Forming!
episode.summary: At Samezuka Academy, the hot-blooded practices continue ahead of regionals. Meanwhile, the Iwatobi Swim Club trains diligently each day until sundown. Though Amakata-sensei is concerned, Haruka and the boys insist they want to practice as much as possible before the tournament. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: はじまりのエターナルサマー!
Eternal Summer of Beginnings!
Le début de l`été éternel !
Hajimari no Eternal Summer!
episode.summary: Having faced his feelings honestly at last, Haruka tells Makoto, Nagisa, and Rei what he has decided for himself and his future. The Iwatobi Swim Club is once again fully united as they mount the starting block at nationals, ready to swim for themselves, for their friends, and now, for the future as well. Source: crunchyroll
